sections.heading: S3. Ep12. Talking with Eliza Carbines about bidding and tendering work, how to craft a great bid for any size of project, whilst avoiding the common pitfalls frequently seen in failed bids

sections.content: This week, I had the pleasure of speaking with +[Eliza Carbines](https://www.linkedin.com/in/eliza-carbines/)+, the Founding Director of +[Tender Relief](https://tenderrelief.com.au/)+.  Eliza brings a wealth of experience in tender and bid management, spanning across various industries, including the built environment.  Around four and a half to five years ago, she established her own business in Western Australia, specializing in understanding procurement requirements and providing tender process management to secure project wins.

During our conversation, we delved into the nuances between public and private sector tendering, exploring the different approaches and processes involved.  Eliza shared valuable tips for individuals and organizations embarking on bid preparation for specific projects â€“ from smaller projects through to mega developments.  She also highlighted common mistakes to avoid, shedding light on the pitfalls that can hinder a successful tender submission.  Whether you're involved in tender creation or simply interested in the topic, this discussion offers practical insights and guidance.

Regardless of the market sector you operate in, Eliza's expertise and advice will prove valuable.  From understanding the intricacies of tendering to grasping key takeaways, there is a wealth of useful information to glean from this episode.  I hope you find Eliza's insights as informative and beneficial as I did.
Amongst other things in this podcast, we discussed:

Exploring the Range of Tender Sizes and Scales
Effective Strategies for Approaching School Tenders

Navigating the Tender Process for Success
Exploring the Role of AI in Tender Writing
